messages.title: This is your LAST CHANCE to stop Theresa May's heartless 'dementia tax'
messages.content: 'Theresa May's proposal would require elderly people receiving social care to fund most of the cost' - Financial Times, 19 May 2017

messages.title: Is this the Britain you want to live in?
messages.content: 'Potentially the biggest new wealth tax of all time'- BBC Online, 19 May 2017 'Conservative manifesto: Theresa May's social care plans would leave elderly helpless' - Evening Standard Online, 18 May 2017 'The Tories' social care plan is a death tax by another name' - The Economist, 18 May 2017

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dems will stop Theresa May's cruel plans to tax people for needing care.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Saving our great schools from becoming failing second rate Secondary Moderns
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dems will reverse all the Conservatives' cuts to our schools and invest an additional £7 billion in education.

issues.education: Saving our great schools from becoming failing second rate Secondary Moderns. Lib Dems will reverse all the Conservatives' cuts to our schools and invest an additional £7 billion in education - making sure every child can go to a great school.
issues.health: 'Theresa May's proposal would require elderly people receiving social care to fund most of the cost' - Financial Times, 19 May 2017. 'Theresa May's social care plan is described as 'a death tax by another name' - The Economist, 18 May 2017. Lib Dems will invest an extra £6 billion each year in the NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: 'Theresa May's proposal would require elderly people receiving social care to fund most of the cost' - Financial Times, 19 May 2017. 'Conservative manifesto: Theresa May's social care plans would leave elderly helpless' - Evening Standard Online, 18 May 2017. 'The Tories' social care plan is a death tax by another name' - The Economist, 18 May 2017. Lib Dems will invest an extra £6 billion each year in the NHS.

community.content: Stopping Theresa May's cruel 'dementia tax'. Lib Dems will stop Theresa May's cruel plans to tax people for needing care. By increasing Income Tax by just 1p, the Lib Dems will fully fund our NHS and social care by: Investing an extra £6 billion each year in our NHS, guaranteeing person in real terms of at least 2.5% a year, capping care costs at a sensible level.

politicalExperience.achievements: Tony is determined to restore funding to our schools and stop Conservatives' plans to turn them into second-rate Secondary Moderns.

contactInformation.address: Liberal Democrats, FREEPOST RSTK-HSKH-EJGE London, SW1P 3AE

endorsements.endorsement: 'We, the undersigned, back the Liberal Democrat campaign against Theresa May's heartless Dementia Tax.'

examples: 'Theresa May's proposal would require elderly people receiving social care to fund most of the cost' - Financial Times, 19 May 2017
'Potentially the biggest new wealth tax of all time'- BBC Online, 19 May 2017
'Conservative manifesto: Theresa May's social care plans would leave elderly helpless' - Evening Standard, 18 May 2017
'The Tories' social care plan is a death tax by another name' - The Economist, 18 May 2017
Only Tony Hill and the Lib Dems can stop the 'dementia tax' in Maidenhead

Tony Hill said: 'Theresa May's Dementia Tax is a betrayal of all those who have worked hard all their lives and need our help in their old age. Even with her u-turn, she has still not caps the cost that people will pay. The Liberal Democrats Jenny will not press to save the NHS and social care and make sure that those who have worked. Hard all their lives Themselves from that they are unlucky enough to fall ill.'
Lib Dems will reverse all the Conservatives' cuts to our schools and invest an additional £7 billion in education - making sure every child can go to a great school.
Lib Dems will invest an extra £6 billion each year in the NHS.
'The Tories' social care plan is a death tax by another name' - The Economist, 18 May 2017

personalStories.story: As a former Head teacher of one of our great schools, Tony is determined to restore funding to our schools and stop Conservatives' plans to turn them into second-rate Secondary Moderns.
